questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.

You need to export the details of a retention label. The export must include the following information:

• Is record
• Is regulatory
• Disposition type

What should you do?

choices.D: From PowerShell, run the Export-ActivityExplorerData cmdlet.
choices.E: From PowerShell, run the Get-RetentionEvent cmdlet.
choices.B: From the Microsoft Purview compliance portal export a file plan.
choices.A: From the Microsoft Purview compliance portal, export Compliance Manager assessment actions.
choices.C: From the Microsoft Purview compliance portal, export a disposition review.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct, others does not apply to this
The file plan is correct, I have exported the file plan and the required records are present.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that uses Microsoft Teams and contains a user named User1.

You configure Microsoft Purview Information Barriers.

You need to identify which information barrier policies apply to User1.

Which cmdlet should you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Instruct the compliance department users to review the DLP incidents report.

The DLP incidents report provides detailed information about DLP policy violations, including the justifications provided by users when overriding DLP policy violations. This allows the compliance department users to review the justifications directly within the report.

Selected Answer: A
I wrote the exam today, this question was on it, I choose A, scored 890!
DLP false positives and overrides If your DLP policy allows users to override it or report a false positive, this report shows a count of such instances over time.

choices.C: Instruct the compliance department users to review the DLP incidents report.
choices.D: Configure an Azure logic app to route DLP notification emails to the compliance department.
choices.A: Instruct the compliance department users to review the False positive and override report.
choices.B: Configure a Microsoft Power Automate workflow to route DLP notification emails to the compliance department.

questions.question_text:
You need to recommend a solution that meets the compliance requirements for viewing DLP tooltip justifications.
What should you recommend?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Claim capacity.

Before you can enable forensic evidence capturing in insider risk management, you need to claim capacity for your organization. This ensures that adequate resources are reserved for evidence collection and investigation. After claiming capacity, you can proceed with configuring other aspects of insider risk management, such as creating policies and enabling evidence capture.

wrong:
Step 1: Confirm your subscription and configure data storage access
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/insider-risk-management-forensic-evidence-configure

comments.content: I do not see anywhere on that link where is explains "claim capacity"
You read and tell us the answer :)
so what is the right answer than?

You too talkin about the same thing :) 
D is correct ~

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.

You plan to use insider risk management to collect and investigate forensic evidence.

You need to enable forensic evidence capturing.

What should you do first?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Native Mode integrates Yammer entirely within Microsoft 365, enabling features like communication compliance policies that leverage Microsoft Purview for content analysis.

Selected Answer: B
Correct B
Yammer: Private messages and public community conversations in Yammer are supported in communication compliance policies. Yammer is an optional channel and must be in native mode to support checking of messages and attachments

choices.D: Assign each user a Yammer license.
choices.C: Configure the Yammer network admin settings.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that uses Yammer.

You need to create a Microsoft Purview communication compliance policy that will detect inappropriate images in Yammer conversations.

What should you do first?
